headline: Caterpillar signs deal for CHP plant with 1.1GWh integrated BESS at data centre campus in Utah
summary_80w: Caterpillar has agreed to deploy a CHP plant featuring more than a gigawatt-hour of batteries for a new data centre complex in Utah, US.

headline: Ampyr Australia starts construction on 600MWh BESS in New South Wales
summary_80w: Ampyr Australia has officially started construction on its 300MW/600MWh Wellington Stage 1 BESS in New South Wales.

headline: FINANCING ROUND-UP: CREC, BRUC, Qair and Greenalia secure funds for projects
summary_80w: This week several solar developers have raised funds for projects around the world, including BRUC in Europe, Greenalia in the US, Qair in Mauritius and CREC in Philippines.

headline: US market, slow residential demand impact SMA Solar H1 2025 results
summary_80w: German solar inverter manufacturer SMA Solar posted losses in the first half of 2025, as demand in the residential and corporate & industrial (C&I) solar sectors 'remains weak'.

headline: Array Technologies posts revenue of US$362.2 million in Q2 2025
summary_80w: US solar tracker manufacturer Array Technologies has posted revenue of US$362.2 million in the second quarter of this year.

headline: ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ Act brings changes, some clarity to US energy storage development
summary_80w: Energy storage escaped much of the pain inflicted on solar, but foreign entity restrictions may create some supply-chain challenges.

headline: US to kill US$7 billion Solar For All support for low-income households
summary_80w: Solar PV is likely to become less accessible to low-income Americans after the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) cancels the US$7 billion Solar For All scheme.

headline: Genneia commissions 180MW solar PV in Argentina
summary_80w: Argentinian renewables developer Genneia has reached commercial operations at its 180MW Parque Solar Anchoris in Argentina.

headline: SolarEdge ships more than 1GW of inverters for second consecutive quarter
summary_80w: SolarEdge posted inverter shipments of 1.19GW in the second quarter of this year, alongside BESS sales of 247MWh.

headline: Ib vogt breaks ground on 99MWp solar PV plant in the Philippines
summary_80w: German renewable energy developer ib vogt has officially broken ground on a 99MWp solar PV power plant in South Cotabato, the Philippines.

headline: ‘A win for Transatlantic relations’ but a ‘big loss’ for creditors: Lyten’s Northvolt deal
summary_80w: Lyten's deal to acquire and recommence operations of European battery firm Northvolt out of bankruptcy has winners and losers, but some of the challenges that led to its demise have already been solved.

headline: Indiana county officials reject 800MWh LFP BESS proposal, despite MISO capacity warnings
summary_80w: Officials at the Zoning Board of Appeals for Hamilton County, Indiana, have rejected an application for a lithium iron phosphate BESS from developer Aypa Power.

headline: Portland General Electric completes over 1.9GWh of BESS projects in Oregon
summary_80w: Utility Portland General Electric (PGE) announced the completion of three battery energy storage systems (BESS) totalling more than 1.9GWh in Portland, Oregon, US.

headline: Transformers arrive at AGL’s 1,000MWh BESS in New South Wales, Australia
summary_80w: Australian energy major AGL Energy has confirmed that two transformers for the 1,000MWh Liddell battery energy storage system (BESS) in New South Wales have been delivered.

headline: Arevon powers 758MW/1.2GWh solar-plus-storage plant in California
summary_80w: Independent power producer Arevon Energy has powered the second phase of the Eland solar-plus-storage Center in Los Angeles, California.

headline: D3Energy breaks ground on 6MW floating solar farm in Ohio
summary_80w: US-based floating solar (FPV) developer D3Energy is constructing a 6MW floating solar system in Monroeville – a village in Huron County, Ohio.

headline: Texas: Ascend Analytics optimises 50MWh for Adapture, SolarMax to build 430MWh project
summary_80w: Optimisation platform provider Ascend Analytics and EPC firm SolarMax Technologies have announced battery storage projects by clients and partners in Texas’ ERCOT market.

headline: Energy Vault receives approval for green hydrogen-BESS microgrid to participate in California market
summary_80w: Energy storage developer and system integrator Energy Vault has received approval to pursue market-based participation in the California Independent System Operator (CAISO) with the Calistoga Resiliency Centre (CRC).

headline: Calibrant begins operating three distributed front-of-the-meter BESS in New York
summary_80w: Calibrant, a joint venture between Green Investment Group and German engineering company Siemens, has energised and begun generating Value of Distributed Energy Resources (VDER) credits from three front-of-the-meter battery energy storage systems (BESS) in New York, US.

headline: US bankruptcy court approves FlexGen acquisition of Powin assets, including all IP
summary_80w: Software-focused energy storage system integrator FlexGen’s bid to acquire assets from bankrupt rival Powin has been approved in court.
